body.name: MOUNTUP Studless TV Wall Mount for Most 19-55 Inch TVs, No Drill TV Mount Fit for Drywall Up to 88lbs, Max Vesa 400 x 400mm, No Stud TV Hanger Wall Mount TV Bracket, Easy Install, Ultra Slim, MU0060
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest Same-Day delivery Today 5 PM - 10 PM. Order within 4 hrs 32 mins
features: No Stud TV Wall Mount: Tired of the hassle of finding studs or drilling big holes in your wall? This MOUNTUP no-stud TV wall mount does not require any drilling or installation experience at all. Just with a hammer, you can secure the tv wall mount onto drywall with nails.

Wide Compatibility: The studless TV mount fits most 19″–55″ flat-screen TVs with VESA patterns 100x100 to 400x400mm. Load capacity is up to 88 lbs. Please check TV VESA, TV weight, and compatible wall type for a better experience (Note: Recommended for drywall, but not for concrete or brick wall).

Low Profile TV Mount: Ultra-slim TV mount holds your TV only 1.06″ from the wall, minimizing gaps and saving space significantly. The small studless TV mount keeps a sleek and tidy appearance after being mounted.

Easy Installation: The innovative circular snap-on holder design allows for quickly and securely attaching your TV to the wall plate with added safety. Hanging your TV is now as easy as hanging a picture frame, pushing to the left to secure the TV, and pushing to the right to remove the TV without to use of any tools.

Won't Damage Walls: No-stud TV wall mount installs with tiny nails. If need to remove it, the hanger only leaves a tiny pinhole that is easily patched and painted in the wall, suitable for drywall. MOUNTUP no drill tv mount comes with bubble level, detailed instructions, and all necessary hardware kits for easy mounting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: 42" older/heaver Vizio 200×200.I'm short & disabled and was able to do this solo. Feels very secure. Just take your time to level it good and think about lamps/windows/lighting for any glare.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to hang
reviews.reviewText: This fit what I needed perfectly. It was easy to hang and seems to be very sturdy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked like a charm.
reviews.reviewText: This worked really well for me and wasn't difficult to mount in a recessed space between 2 kitchen cabinets with 2-3 inches on each side. The only thing worth mentioning is that possibly it could be made clearer about the appropriate pegs to attach to the back of the TV, but maybe that's just user error on my part.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Worked perfect for my new man cave. Hung a 65 inch tv onto dry wall. Have had to take it down a handful of times to change wires out but overall hasn’t given me any problem. Just be careful because it does allow for very minimal space between wall and tv so be prepared with cords that bend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works, but leaves little space between TV and wall.
reviews.reviewText: This mount comes with most of what you'll need to install this (Comes with level, nails, screws, velcro cable ties, but you'll need a hammer). There are two parts to this: the part that you attach to the TV VESA screw holes(two round plastic knobs that hook on the rack, and two at the bottom that stabilize your TV on the wall; the second part is the mount rack, which you nail to the wall. The installation holes in the mount rack are designed so that the nails go in at a downward angle. Once you have fixed the plastic pieces at the back of the TV, you slide them down into the slots on the rack mounted on the wall. The width of the knob spacing at the back of the TV is determined by the VESA type measurements of your TV.Note: There are two things to note with this mount. First, you have to install whatever cables on the back of the TV before you hang it up. Secondly, this mount installs very flat with a low profile. That is, there will be very little space between the wall and the TV. This means that you might have to invest in an angled power plug that drops to the side or straight down and not the regular kind that shoots straight out.I installed a 43 inch monitor this way. It weighs about 20 or so pounds, and so far, it seems to be holding up

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works Well and Is Inexpensive
reviews.reviewText: We just replaced our old 50” TV with a 65” one in the living room. My husband is interested in sim racing and wanted to use the old TV instead of a small computer monitor. That’s where this wall mount came in. It’s easy to use. It is basically a long hook you fasten to a vertical surface.Installing it is easy, the mount has a row of several holes aligned horizontally so you can line them with a wall frame. This gives you flexibility since you can offset it horizontally with the wall frame. Another nice thing is that the pegs you attach to the VESA holes in the back of your TV have a mushroom shape, so when you hang the tv, the pegs slide into the slots very securely. The TV stays put.It worked well and is inexpensive at $16 plus tax.
